definition: (indicating agreement) yes/all right/(drawing attention to) look!/here!/variant of 諾|诺[nuo4]
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
(old) to bow and utter polite phrases/to open the way (for a dignitary etc)
(old) to bow and utter polite phrases/to open the way (for a dignitary etc)

sentences.english: Say, do you smell something burning in the kitchen?
sentences.chinese: 喏，你有沒有聞到廚房裏有燒焦的味道呀？

sentences.english: Now then - hold out your hands and close your eyes.
sentences.chinese: 喏，伸出你的手，閉上你的眼睛。

sentences.english: You can see it through the window, from where you stand.
sentences.chinese: 喏，就在你站的地方往裏看，你就能看到啦。
喏，接住你的柺棍兒，走吧。

sentences.english: Ahoy, the first house of first row in the west.
sentences.chinese: 喏，就在西邊第一排房子的第一個門。

sentences.english: Look, Brent! I know where we can go for supper.
sentences.chinese: 喏，布倫特，我想起可以到哪兒去喫晚飯了。

sentences.english: B: In that case, here, you go first.

definition: sentence-final particle (abbr. for 呢啊[ne5 a5] or variant of 哪[na5])
interjection indicating approval, appreciation or agreement
to hand over/to pass on sth/to gradually increase or decrease/progressively
interjection of wonder, shock or admiration
(final particle equivalent to 了[le5])/(particle calling attention to, or mildly warning of, a situation)
(final particle similar to 了[le5], indicating that sth is obvious)
